description.narrative: The project development objective is to strengthen the capacity of Government of Bangladesh agencies to respond to emergencyeventsand to strengthen systems to reduce the vulnerability of future building construction to disasters in Dhaka and Sylhet.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Disaster Management and Relief
Ministry of Housing and Public Works
Ministry of Local Government, Rural Development, and Cooperatives

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall adopt, and thereafter maintain, the Project Operational Manual
The Recipient shall and ensure that the Emergency Response Part is carried out in accordance with the Contingent Emergency ResponseImplementation Plan
The Recipient shall ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance with the provisions of the EMF, the SMF and the relevantSafeguard Assessments and Plans

The Recipient shall establish by no later than one month after the Effective Date and thereafter maintain,throughout the period ofimplementation of the Project: (a) the Apex Project Steering Committee; (b) the Project Coordination and Monitoring Unit; and (c)ineach of the Implementing Agencies, a Project Implementation Unit.

The Recipient shall prior to the commencement of any activity, proceed to have a Safeguard Assessment and Plan: (i) prepared inaccordance with the provisions of the EMF and the SMF; and; and (ii) in the case of any resettlement activity under the Projectinvolving Affected Persons, ensure that no displacement shall occur before necessary resettlement measures consistent with the RAP

title.narrative: E-Permits for construction issued by RAJUK
Systems established to reduce vulnerability of new buildings
DDM/DNCC/DSCC/SCC/FSCD and Satellite Control Room facilities equipped with ECT suites and/or kits
Identified and prioritized critical and essential facilities and lifelines for Dhaka
FSCD emergency management warehouses equipped with specialized search and rescue equipment
Wards with decentralized emergency response services in Sylhet (SCC jurisdiction)
Urban Resilience Unit facility of RAJUK constructed
Vulnerability of prioritized critical and essential facilities and lifelines assessed for Dhaka
Wards with decentralized emergency response services in Dhaka (DNCC/DSCC jurisdiction)
Risk-sensitive land use planning practice for Dhaka developed
Urban Resilience Unit facility of RAJUK equipped with laboratory and field testing equipment
Training sessions to government officals and emergency management personnel delivered
Increased capacity of officials and emergency management response personnel
New building code implementation and enforcement strategy developed
Professional Accreditation Program developed and/or strenghtened
Vulnerability reduction strategy and program for Dhaka developed
